text: hello i'm chef john from food wishes
comm with how to dry-aged your own
steaks at home believe it or not so
really nice steak houses have
unbelievably delicious steak because
they aged the steak for weeks in a
specially controlled environment and
they get a really deep delicious flavor
and texture and then i heard about a
website that actually is selling a kit
to do this at home using a specially
designed bag that will dry-aged the
steak it's called dry bag steak calm
so i said i'd love to test that so
they're not paying me i want to be clear
but they did send me the kit to try this
out so here's how you can dry-aged your
own steaks at home so this is kind of an
experiment and in a few weeks we'll see
how it worked so i have one full strip
loin that's what you cut New York strips
from all right so I'm gonna unwrap that
it's about 10 to 11 pounds generally
it's fully trimmed meaning that really
thick fat cap that comes out in New York
strip loin has been cut off they of
course leave a little bit of fat on
which you really need for steaks so
don't do any more trimming you're just
going to get a trim to strip loin I'm
going to Pat it dry with some paper
towel all right and here are the
specially designed dry bag steak bags
so apparently lets the moisture out but
keeps the oxygen from getting in so you
know sounds pretty scientific so anyway
we're going to place our strip loin in
I'm going to put the small side in first
just to make it easier we're going to
slide that in and the directions say to
kind of cozy it up into the corner all
right so that's what I did you're also
going to want to trim off you only want
four or so inches of leftover plastic at
the end there all right so I'm going to
trim that off now here is our snorkel
type vacuum heat sealer so this comes
with the kit and it's specially designed
for this process alright it has a little
lock thing there so if you press down
the unit opens so I'm going to open it
up I'm going to flip on the power and
then we're going to do three seals so
what you got to do is you got to seal
each corner so I'm going to put one
corner in snap it down which locks it
now there's a seal light right there
okay so what you're going to do is
you're going to push down on that seal
bar the lights going to fly
- and then you're going to hear the
alarm hey did you hear that that means
it's done let it cool for you know a few
seconds and there you have a nicely
sealed corner we're going to seal the
other corner and we want to leave about
a three inch gap in the center so I'm
going to put that right corner in seal
it wait for the alarm let go let it cool
for a minute all right click on the
little lock buttons there snaps it open
very simple all right so we have our two
corners sealed and like I said we're
going to leave about a three inch gap so
we can put that snorkel attachment in
and suck out the air you're going to use
your finger in that snorkel attachment
just pushes right out and as soon as it
fully extends you'll hear the vacuum
start
I'm going to place the opening of the
bag right over that little snorkel they
call it make sure it's in the opening
not above or under it we're going to
lock the unit down and we're not going
to seal it yet it's going to take about
ten seconds and it's slowly going to
suck all the air out of there you can
hear the kind of motor going and you
want to get all the air oh it's going to
give you a really tight seal when all
the air is out then you're going to
press that seal bar down wait for the
alarm just like we did with the other
two seals let it cool for a minute and
that's it
so we have our three seals two corners
in the center the air is out of there
now very important you got to let that
sit for I don't know three or four
minutes and observe it if there's any
holes or if any part of the seal wasn't
perfect it will not hold that you know
tight vacuum shape this one's fine
you're going to put that in a
refrigerator make sure there's air
circulation on the top and bottom and
we're going to age that for seven to 21
days is what they recommend so you're
going to see this when it's done we'll
do a nice test I'll grill these off and
we will taste our own homemade dry-aged
steaks using the dry bag steak method
and we'll both decide if it's worth it
anyway a little more info on the site if
you want to check it out and as always
enjoy
